title: website logging me out, only on Firefox
content: Hi, I'm not sure if this is the right place to log this issue or not, but I just started experiencing an issue with a website I use a lot for work, teamwork.com. When I click the bookmark to my organization's subdomain, it starts to go to the page as usual but then logs me out of the site automatically. On the logout page, it gives me the option to login again, but then it does the same thing and logs me out. I've tried it on other browsers and don't have that issue. I've never had this issue before, and prefer using Firefox over other browsers so I wanted to see if there was a fix. Thanks for your help!

creator: iKingNinja

title: One cause of Windows Photos app crashing = Firefox
content:
Hello everyone,

This is NOT a question. I just want to share this info to others.

Yesterday, I was tearing my hair because the Photos app in my Windows 11 just kept on crashing when I opened any image file (jpg, png, etc). "Crashing" means the window was partially displayed on the screen but not the content, then two or three seconds later, it just closed itself!

Then by pure chance, I had to exit Firefox. After that, Photos app was working just fine. I was thinking "what?" Then I reopened Firefox. Photos app crashed on opening. So I was 100% sure that for some reason, running Firefox would crash Photos app.

So I think I had to share this information to the community. Here I am.

Have a nice day.

title: unable to open emails from Royal Mail on Firefox, but they WILL open on Safari and DuckDuckGo
content:
Hello!

I have a problem which seems to be only with my Firefox browser regarding Royal Mail emails!

I use a Mac desktop computer, and my email account is with btinternet.com

Recently, when I get an email notification about an (expected) delivery from Royal Mail, the actual content of the email is blank when I’m using Firefox as my browser.

At first, I assumed this was btinternet.com blocking Royal Mail, for some reason. However, I discovered yesterday that this problem does not exist when I access my email via Safari or DuckDuckGo! I can access the content of the emails just fine if I use either of these other browsers.

I also have Firefox installed on my iPad AND on my Android phone. The same thing happens on both of these devices as well—so this is not an issue with my Mac computer. I can access the content of the email from Royal Mail via either Safari (on my iPad) or DuckDuckGo (on iPad AND my android phone.) However, neither of these will show me the email when I use Firefox.

I can access the actual Royal Mail website with Firefox on my computer, no problem. It’s just when I try to open emails from them that the problem arises.

No idea what is causing this anomaly. I can’t pinpoint exactly when it started, but it’s been going on for at least a month and maybe more.

I use the latest version of Firefox at all times on all devices, and my operating systems are up to date on my devices as well. (I have the latest version of Sonoma on my Mac, I have iOS 17.7 on my iPad, and whatever the latest update for Motorola e14 is.)

I’m hoping you can offer a bit of advice. This is very annoying, as Firefox is my default browser on both my Mac AND my Motorola phone.
creator: janfol

title: Problems with Best i5 Laptop and Mozilla Firefox – Any Advice?
content:
Hey everyone,

I’m experiencing some frustrating issues with Mozilla Firefox on my best i5 laptop. My laptop is fairly new and handles most tasks smoothly, but when it comes to browsing with Firefox, I’m running into several problems.

Here’s what’s happening:

Lagging and Slowness: Whenever I open multiple tabs or use web apps, Firefox becomes sluggish. Pages load slowly, and switching between tabs is much slower than expected.

Freezing: Occasionally, Firefox will freeze for a few seconds, especially when I’m using extensions or trying to stream videos or handle media-heavy websites.

High CPU Usage: I’ve checked my Task Manager, and Firefox is using a surprisingly high amount of CPU resources, which is affecting the overall performance of my best i5 laptop.

Battery Drain: It seems like Firefox is draining my battery faster compared to other browsers, which is frustrating since I rely on my laptop for long periods of usage.

I’ve tried clearing the cache, disabling extensions, and even reinstalling Firefox, but the issues remain. Given that my laptop is one of the best i5 laptops, I’m surprised by these performance problems.

Has anyone else experienced similar issues with Firefox on an i5 laptop? Are there any tweaks, settings, or specific solutions that might help improve performance? I’d appreciate any advice or recommendations to get the most out of Firefox on my system.

Thanks in advance for your help! Looking forward to your suggestions!
creator: moorejulie199

title: Mozilla Firefox Profiler Power
content:
Hi,

I am running a simple web based chat app on a local server. I want to compare the energy usage between three version of the app, using long polling, websocket and webRTC for communication. To analyze the result I am downloading the captured power profile from Firefox. This stores as a JSON file. However, I am having issues parsing the file into anything useful. Do you have a guide on how to parse these output files so that I can sort on the various energy usage components? In the visual capture of the profile all the data is available nicely to see. I would like to use the JSON files to make tables of total energy usage etc.

Best regards, Anders
